head.title: Browse records of other archives | The National Archives

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: government information, archive, history, information management, national archives, public records, manuscripts, documents

meta.name: description
meta.content: The official archive of the UK government. Our vision is to lead and transform information management, guarantee the survival of today's information for tomorrow and bring history to life for everyone.

meta.name: DC.subject
meta.content: Public Records, National Archives, History, Government, Documents

meta.name: DC.description
meta.content: The National Archives is the UK government's official archive. Our main duties are to preserve Government records and to set standards in information management and re-use.

a.title: Go to The National Archives homepage

a.aria-label: Change form destination to search the catalogue
Change form destination to search the website

li.a: Our role in the archives sector

div.span: Records created, acquired, and inherited by Chancery, and also of the Wardrobe, Royal Household, Exchequer and various commissions

p.span: The records are predominantly those of Chancery as the central legal administration of the Crown, and of the court of Chancery as a court of equity and as a common law court.

Also included, however, are many records acquired by Chancery in the course of its official business (either records deposited in Chancery as a government registry, or lodged as exhibits in lawsuits) which were not themselves Chancery records.
A few series consist wholly or partly of records of the Supreme Court of Judicature, the Privy Seal Office, and the Lord Chancellor's Department.
The following series numbers have not been used: C 19-20, C 87, C 130, C 155-170, C 174-180, and C 198-200.
